title: Colorado Firm Recalls Ground Beef Products Due To Mislabeling and Possible Adulteration
summary: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14, 2011 - Colorado Meat Packers, a Denver, Colo., establishment, is recalling approximately 2,234 pounds of beef trim that was improperly labeled and potentially adulterated, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The product label includes "For...
impacted_products: 2,234 lbs. Combo Bin of All Beef Trimmings
